meanings.definition: A situation in which a difficult choice has to be made between two or more alternatives.
meanings.sent1: Facing a dilemma between studying for the test or going to the party.
meanings.sent2: She was in a dilemma about whether to choose the red dress or the blue one.
meanings.sent3: The dilemma of having to decide between ice cream or cake for dessert was a tough one.
meanings.sent4: His dilemma of picking between a vacation at the beach or in the mountains weighed heavily on his mind.
meanings.sent5: The dilemma of whether to save money or splurge on a new phone was causing her stress.

meanings.sent1: The team faced a dilemma when their star player got injured right before the championship.
meanings.sent2: Finding a solution to the dilemma of traffic congestion in the city was a priority.
meanings.sent3: The dilemma of a broken elevator in a skyscraper led to many people taking the stairs.
meanings.sent4: The dilemma of a leaky roof during a storm left the family scrambling for buckets.
meanings.sent5: Dealing with the dilemma of a broken printer on the day of the presentation was frustrating.
